channel.title: Articles on Philip Web Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content in Articles on Philip Web Portfolio

item.title: Project2
item.description: This article is about tuning xgboost model . tuning_xgboost.py helps you using consecutive (greedy) gridsearch with cross validation to tune xgboost hyperparameters in python. This is useful, when the hyperparameter space is too big or you don’t really want to dig too deep into how this all works. I recommend using pairwise gridsearch { Link to Github Repository }(https://github.com/vphilip-solomon/tuning_xgboost)

item.title: Project1
item.description: Ask a home buyer to describe their dream house, and they probably won’t begin with the height of the basement ceiling or the proximity to an east-west railroad. But this playground competition’s dataset proves that much more influences price negotiations than the number of bedrooms or a white-picket fence. With 79 explanatory variables describing (almost) every aspect of residential homes in Ames, Iowa, this competition challenges you to predict the final price of each home.
